poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The first wheel – you can bet – 
Was clog-shod; circular
Tictactoe. The first manned flight
Was feather-fledged, and flapped.
Machines don't need that skeuomorphic stuff.
Recycle tyre-treads as flip-flops – 
No skin off their nose. Baptize yourself
A cog in the wealth condenser – 
Language too is otiose. Sabotage
Sabotage, though, they find that problematic.
